speech:
Identify Your Feelings:
 Understand whatâ€™s causing your unease. Once you identify the source, you can work on addressing it.

Practice Mindfulness:
 Mindfulness techniques, such as deep breathing and meditation, can help you stay present and focused, reducing unease.

Engage in Physical Activity: 
Regular physical activity can help reduce anxiety and improve your mood, which can help manage uneasy feelings.

Talk to Someone You Trust: 
Sharing your feelings with a trusted friend or family member can provide emotional support and help you feel less uneasy.

Limit Your Exposure to Negative Media: 
Graphic news stories or violent films can trigger uneasy feelings.

Seek Professional Help: 
If your uneasy feelings are persistent or hard to manage, consider contacting a doctor or mental health professional
